definition: to repair/to patch/to mend/to make up for/to fill (a vacancy)/to supplement

sentences.english: Scald struggle traditional premium rubber tire less easily than sulfur or sulfur phenomenon.
sentences.chinese: 傳統電燙鬥補胎容易造成橡膠欠硫或過硫的現象。

sentences.english: The invention discloses a tire repair filling liquid.
sentences.chinese: 本發明公開了一種補胎充劑液。

sentences.english: She is guiding the shop to help citizen to fix the tyre up with the standard etiquette.
sentences.chinese: 她在用最標準的禮節，爲市平易近指引補胎的路線。

sentences.english: Larger holes and cuts in tires can be repaired by applying a patch on the inside.
sentences.chinese: 較大的輪胎破口和切口可用補胎片在內側進行修補。

sentences.english: I carried a repair kit12 and pump with me so I could mend tires on the go.
sentences.chinese: 我隨身帶着修理工具和打氣筒，這樣我可以隨時補胎。

sentences.english: Dick saw a woman with a flat tire and offered to give her a hand with it.
sentences.chinese: 狄克見一婦人輪胎泄氣，就自告奮勇幫助她補胎。

sentences.english: Six patches with sandpaper in a neat little carry along box.
sentences.chinese: 小巧的攜帶盒內有6塊補胎片和砂紙。

definition: child bride/girl adopted into a family as future daughter-in-law
half a life/only half alive/barely alive/(scared, beaten etc) half to death
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
all crows are black (idiom)/evil people are bad all over the world
pinyin: tian1 xia4 wu1 ya1 yi1 ban1 hei1

definition: to return something to its rightful owner
lit. to swell one's face up by slapping it to look imposing (idiom); to seek to impress by feigning more than one's abilities
pinyin: da3 zhong3 lian3 chong1 pang4 zi5

definition: lit. killing the chicken to warn the monkey (idiom)/fig. to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
the rice is cooked/what's done is done/it's too late to change anything now (idiom)
pinyin: sheng1 mi3 zhu3 cheng2 shu2 fan4
